roleset.name: live through rocky situation
roleset.note: WEATHER-V NOTES: Be very careful with trace chains--they get tricky! (from weather.01-v)

example.name: very typical
example.text: [Ford]-1, which has long boasted of its ability *trace*-1 to weather a downturn, saw earnings take a beating.

roleset.name: age, break down due to exposure
roleset.note: WEATHER-V, WEATHERING-N, WEATHERED-J NOTES: Added by Julia for clearearth-biotexts.

example.name: weather-v
example.text: For millions of years, wind and water have weathered the surface of the Earth and worn rocks into sediments.

example.name: weathering-n
example.text: a humid hot climate should experience alot of hydrolysis, leaching, oxidation and physical weathering from biological activity but there would be very little or no frost wedging

example.name: weathered-j
example.text: Everybody's skin was weathered from constant exposure to sun, smoke, and repellent;
example.arg: from constant exposure to sun, smoke, and repellent
